author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 20. Mahāvagga
segments.en: 20. The Great Chapter

segments.pli: 191. Sotānugatasutta
segments.en: 191. Followed by Ear

segments.pli: “Sotānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manasānupekkhitānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ cattāro ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, you can expect four benefits when the teachings have been followed by ear, reinforced by recitation, examined by the mind, and well comprehended theoretically.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: Take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
segments.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, reinforced them by recitation, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

segments.pli: So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods.

segments.pli: Tassa tattha sukhino dhammapadā plavanti.
segments.en: Being happy there, passages of the teaching come back to them.

segments.pli: Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha so satto khippaṃyeva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Sotānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manasānupekkhitānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ ayaṃ paṭhamo ānisaṃso pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: This is the first benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, reinforced by recitation, examined by the mind, and well comprehended theoretically.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: Take another mendicant who memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
segments.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, reinforced them by recitation, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

segments.pli: So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods.

segments.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti;
segments.en: Though they’re happy there, passages of the teaching don’t come back to them.

segments.pli: api ca kho bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: However, a mendicant with psychic powers, who has achieved mastery of the mind, teaches Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ vā so dhammavinayo, yatthāhaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarin’ti.
segments.en: ‘I used to live the spiritual life in this same teaching and training.’

segments.pli: Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha so satto khippameva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso kusalo bherisaddassa.
segments.en: Suppose a person was skilled in the sound of drums.

segments.pli: So addhānamaggappaṭipanno bherisaddaṃ suṇeyya.
segments.en: While traveling along a road they hear the sound of drums.

segments.pli: Tassa na heva kho assa kaṅkhā vā vimati vā:
segments.en: They wouldn’t have any doubts or uncertainties about whether

segments.pli: ‘bherisaddo nu kho, na nu kho bherisaddo’ti.
segments.en: that was the sound of drums or not.

segments.pli: Atha kho bherisaddotveva niṭṭhaṃ gaccheyya.
segments.en: They’d just conclude, ‘That’s the sound of drums.’

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: In the same way, take another mendicant who memorizes the teaching …

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods. …

segments.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti;
api ca kho bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti.
Tassa evaṃ hoti:
‘ayaṃ vā so dhammavinayo, yatthāhaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarin’ti.
Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha so satto khippaṃyeva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Sotānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manasānupekkhitānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ ayaṃ dutiyo ānisaṃso pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: This is the second benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, reinforced by recitation, examined by the mind, and well comprehended theoretically.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: Take another mendicant who memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
segments.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, reinforced them by recitation, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

segments.pli: So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods.

segments.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti;
segments.en: But passages of the teaching don’t come back to them when they’re happy, nor does a mendicant with psychic powers … teach Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

segments.pli: api ca kho devaputto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: However, a god teaches Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ vā so dhammavinayo, yatthāhaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarin’ti.
segments.en: ‘I used to live the spiritual life in this same teaching and training.’

segments.pli: Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha so satto khippaṃyeva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso kusalo saṅkhasaddassa.
segments.en: Suppose a person was skilled in the sound of horns.

segments.pli: So addhānamaggappaṭipanno saṅkhasaddaṃ suṇeyya.
segments.en: While traveling along a road they hear the sound of horns.

segments.pli: Tassa na heva kho assa kaṅkhā vā vimati vā:
segments.en: They wouldn’t have any doubt about whether

segments.pli: ‘saṅkhasaddo nu kho, na nu kho saṅkhasaddo’ti.
segments.en: that was the sound of horns or not.

segments.pli: Atha kho saṅkhasaddotveva niṭṭhaṃ gaccheyya.
segments.en: They’d just conclude, ‘That’s the sound of horns.’

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: In the same way, take another mendicant who memorizes the teaching …

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods. …

segments.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti;
api ca kho devaputto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti.
Tassa evaṃ hoti:
‘ayaṃ vā so dhammavinayo, yatthāhaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarin’ti.
Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha so satto khippaṃyeva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Sotānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manasānupekkhitānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ ayaṃ tatiyo ānisaṃso pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: This is the third benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, reinforced by recitation, examined by the mind, and well comprehended theoretically.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: Take another mendicant who memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
segments.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, reinforced them by recitation, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

segments.pli: So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods.

segments.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, napi devaputto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti;
segments.en: But passages of the teaching don’t come back to them when they’re happy, and neither a mendicant with psychic powers … nor a god teaches Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

segments.pli: api ca kho opapātiko opapātikaṃ sāreti:
segments.en: But a being who has been reborn spontaneously reminds another such being:

segments.pli: ‘sarasi tvaṃ, mārisa, sarasi tvaṃ, mārisa, yattha mayaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarimhā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Do you remember, good sir? Do you remember where we used to live the spiritual life?’

segments.pli: So evamāha:
segments.en: He says:

segments.pli: ‘sarāmi, mārisa, sarāmi, mārisā’ti.
segments.en: ‘I remember, good sir, I remember!’

segments.pli: Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha so satto khippaṃyeva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dve sahāyakā sahapaṃsukīḷikā.
segments.en: Suppose there were two friends who had played together in the sand.

segments.pli: Te kadāci karahaci aññamaññaṃ samāgaccheyyuṃ.
segments.en: Some time or other they’d meet.

segments.pli: Añño pana sahāyako sahāyakaṃ evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: And one friend would say to the other:

segments.pli: ‘idampi, samma, sarasi, idampi, samma, sarasī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Do you remember this, friend? Do you remember that, friend?’

segments.pli: So evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: They’d say:

segments.pli: ‘sarāmi, samma, sarāmi, sammā’ti.
segments.en: ‘I remember, friend, I remember!’

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: In the same way, take another mendicant who memorizes the teaching …

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
So muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: But they die unmindful and are reborn in one of the orders of gods. …

segments.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, napi devaputto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti;
api ca kho opapātiko opapātikaṃ sāreti:
‘sarasi tvaṃ, mārisa, sarasi tvaṃ, mārisa, yattha mayaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarimhā’ti.
So evamāha:
‘sarāmi, mārisa, sarāmi, mārisā’ti.
Dandho, bhikkhave, satuppādo;
segments.en: Memory comes up slowly,

segments.pli: atha kho so satto khippaṃyeva visesagāmī hoti.
segments.en: but then that being quickly reaches distinction.

segments.pli: Sotānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manasānupekkhitānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ ayaṃ catuttho ānisaṃso pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: This is the fourth benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, reinforced by recitation, examined by the mind, and well comprehended theoretically.

segments.pli: Sotānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manasānupekkhitānaṃ diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ ime cattāro ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
segments.en: You can expect these four benefits when the teachings have been followed by ear, reinforced by recitation, examined by the mind, and well comprehended theoretically.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, you can expect four benefits when the teachings…

suttaplex.blurb: The benefits in the next life of studying Dharma in this life.
